summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from August 1, 2019, between a Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and an unidentified recipient, discussing a request for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt. The communication highlights internal DOJ/BOP coordination regarding Epstein's mental health status shortly before his death.

persons.name: Psy.D. Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist, U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: The Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who is corresponding about sending notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt. They request a HIPAA authorization before releasing information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the requested notes regarding his suicide attempt while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist was responsible for Epstein's mental health assessment and notes regarding his suicide attempt while in custody.

events.title: Request for Epstein Suicide Notes
events.description: An initial request is made for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt.

events.title: HIPAA Authorization Request
events.description: The Chief Psychologist responds to the request for Epstein's notes, stating a HIPAA authorization is needed before releasing the information.

events.title: Urgent Follow-up for Notes
events.description: A follow-up message is sent urgently requesting the notes on Epstein's suicide attempt 'asap'.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and where the Chief Psychologist was based.

keyFacts: On August 1, 2019, there was internal communication within the DOJ/BOP regarding obtaining notes on Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt.
The Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center required a HIPAA authorization before releasing Epstein's mental health notes.
The request for notes was marked as urgent ('asap'), indicating time-sensitive interest in Epstein's condition.
The correspondence occurred just days before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, making it relevant to investigations into his suicide.
